field.name: anchors
field.definition: where you want the origin of the texture. *"texture" uses the texture coordinates supplied *"screen" uses the origin of the screen as the origin of the texture

field.name: blending function
field.definition: how to blend the textures together

field.name: map scales
field.definition: how much to scale the textures

field.name: map offsets
field.definition: how much to offset the origin of the texture

field.name: map
field.definition: which maps to use

field.name: source/destination
field.definition: These describe the relationship that causes the effect. * destination type is the type of variable you want to be effected * destination tells which texture map (or geometry offset) to apply it to * source says which value to look at when computing the effect

field.name: in/out bounds
field.definition: When the source is at the lower inbound, the destination ends up the lower outbound and vice-versa applies for the upper values.

field.name: tint color bounds
field.definition: If destination is tint, these values are used instead of the out bounds.

field.name: periodic functions
field.definition: If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

field.name: periodic functions
field.definition: If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

definition.entry: interpolate between min/max flash colors as state changes

field.name: value scale
field.help: used for non-integral values, i.e. health and shields

field.definition: The blips use this as a reference point
